title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: bib2df - Parse a BibTeX file to a data.frame
text: BibTeX typically used together LaTeX manage references. BibTeX file format simple follows rather simple strict rules represents reference’s core data list partly mandatory fields. resulting BibTeX file can tell much work use , may academic paper, dissertation report least partly appoints work others. average age referenced works might tell one addresses current topic one digs history certain field. one cite many works just authors occurs every author ? BibTeX file definitely able answer questions.

title: bib2df - Parse a BibTeX file to a data.frame
text: mentioned , BibTeX represents entries lists named fields, kind similar JSON format. want gain insights BibTeX file using R, transform data fit usual data structure. data structure, speaking R, tibble. bib2df exactly : takes BibTeX file parses tibble can work bibliographic data just way data. Given tibble can manipulate entries familiar way write updated references back valid BibTeX file.

title: bib2df - Parse a BibTeX file to a data.frame
text: parse BibTeX file tibble may want use function bib2df(). first argument bib2df() path file want parse. bib2df() returns tibble row representing one entry initial BibTeX file columns hold data originally stored named fields. field present particular entry, respective column gets value NA. works can work multiple authors editors, fields converted list avoid names multiple persons concatenated single character string: second argument bib2df() separate_names calls, TRUE, functionality humaniformat 1 package automatically split persons’ names pieces:
code: install.packages("bib2df") library(bib2df)  path <- system.file("extdata", "LiteratureOnCommonKnowledgeInGameTheory.bib", package = "bib2df")  df <- bib2df(path) df ## # A tibble: 37 × 27 ##    CATEGORY   BIBTEXKEY ADDRESS ANNOTE AUTHOR BOOKTITLE CHAPTER CROSSREF EDITION ##    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>   <chr>  <list> <chr>     <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   ##  1 ARTICLE    Arrow1986 NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  2 ARTICLE    AumannBr… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  3 ARTICLE    Aumann19… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  4 INCOLLECT… Bacharac… Cambri… NA     <chr>  Knowledg… 17      NA       NA      ##  5 ARTICLE    Basu1988  NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  6 ARTICLE    Bernheim… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  7 ARTICLE    Bicchier… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  8 ARTICLE    Binmore2… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  9 ARTICLE    Brandenb… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ## 10 INCOLLECT… Brandenb… New Yo… NA     <chr>  The Econ… 3       NA       NA      ## # ℹ 27 more rows ## # ℹ 18 more variables: EDITOR <list>, HOWPUBLISHED <chr>, INSTITUTION <chr>, ## #   JOURNAL <chr>, KEY <chr>, MONTH <chr>, NOTE <chr>, NUMBER <chr>, ## #   ORGANIZATION <chr>, PAGES <chr>, PUBLISHER <chr>, SCHOOL <chr>, ## #   SERIES <chr>, TITLE <chr>, TYPE <chr>, VOLUME <chr>, YEAR <dbl>, DOI <chr> head(df$AUTHOR) ## [[1]] ## [1] "Arrow, Kenneth J." ##  ## [[2]] ## [1] "Aumann, Robert"      "Brandenburger, Adam" ##  ## [[3]] ## [1] "Aumann, Robert J." ##  ## [[4]] ## [1] "Bacharach, Michael" ##  ## [[5]] ## [1] "Basu, Kaushik" ##  ## [[6]] ## [1] "Bernheim, B. Douglas" df <- bib2df(path, separate_names = TRUE) head(df$AUTHOR) ## [[1]] ##   salutation first_name middle_name last_name suffix        full_name ## 1       <NA>    Kenneth          J.     Arrow   <NA> Kenneth J. Arrow ##  ## [[2]] ##   salutation first_name middle_name     last_name suffix          full_name ## 1       <NA>     Robert        <NA>        Aumann   <NA>      Robert Aumann ## 2       <NA>       Adam        <NA> Brandenburger   <NA> Adam Brandenburger ##  ## [[3]] ##   salutation first_name middle_name last_name suffix        full_name ## 1       <NA>     Robert          J.    Aumann   <NA> Robert J. Aumann ##  ## [[4]] ##   salutation first_name middle_name last_name suffix         full_name ## 1       <NA>    Michael        <NA> Bacharach   <NA> Michael Bacharach ##  ## [[5]] ##   salutation first_name middle_name last_name suffix    full_name ## 1       <NA>    Kaushik        <NA>      Basu   <NA> Kaushik Basu ##  ## [[6]] ##   salutation first_name middle_name last_name suffix           full_name ## 1       <NA>         B.     Douglas  Bernheim   <NA> B. Douglas Bernheim

title: bib2df - Parse a BibTeX file to a data.frame
text: Multiple BibTeX files can parsed using lapply(). paths BibTeX files must stored vector. Using vector call bib2df() within lapply() results list tibble, can bound, e.g. using bind_rows():
code: bib1 <- system.file("extdata", "LiteratureOnCommonKnowledgeInGameTheory.bib", package = "bib2df") bib2 <- system.file("extdata", "r.bib", package = "bib2df") paths <- c(bib1, bib2)  x <- lapply(paths, bib2df) class(x) ## [1] "list" head(x) ## [[1]] ## # A tibble: 37 × 27 ##    CATEGORY   BIBTEXKEY ADDRESS ANNOTE AUTHOR BOOKTITLE CHAPTER CROSSREF EDITION ##    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>   <chr>  <list> <chr>     <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   ##  1 ARTICLE    Arrow1986 NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  2 ARTICLE    AumannBr… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  3 ARTICLE    Aumann19… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  4 INCOLLECT… Bacharac… Cambri… NA     <chr>  Knowledg… 17      NA       NA      ##  5 ARTICLE    Basu1988  NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  6 ARTICLE    Bernheim… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  7 ARTICLE    Bicchier… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  8 ARTICLE    Binmore2… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ##  9 ARTICLE    Brandenb… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ## 10 INCOLLECT… Brandenb… New Yo… NA     <chr>  The Econ… 3       NA       NA      ## # ℹ 27 more rows ## # ℹ 18 more variables: EDITOR <list>, HOWPUBLISHED <chr>, INSTITUTION <chr>, ## #   JOURNAL <chr>, KEY <chr>, MONTH <chr>, NOTE <chr>, NUMBER <chr>, ## #   ORGANIZATION <chr>, PAGES <chr>, PUBLISHER <chr>, SCHOOL <chr>, ## #   SERIES <chr>, TITLE <chr>, TYPE <chr>, VOLUME <chr>, YEAR <dbl>, DOI <chr> ##  ## [[2]] ## # A tibble: 1 × 27 ##   CATEGORY BIBTEXKEY ADDRESS    ANNOTE AUTHOR BOOKTITLE CHAPTER CROSSREF EDITION ##   <chr>    <chr>     <chr>      <chr>  <list> <chr>     <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   ## 1 MANUAL   NA        Vienna, A… NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ## # ℹ 18 more variables: EDITOR <list>, HOWPUBLISHED <chr>, INSTITUTION <chr>, ## #   JOURNAL <chr>, KEY <chr>, MONTH <chr>, NOTE <chr>, NUMBER <chr>, ## #   ORGANIZATION <chr>, PAGES <chr>, PUBLISHER <chr>, SCHOOL <chr>, ## #   SERIES <chr>, TITLE <chr>, TYPE <chr>, VOLUME <chr>, YEAR <dbl>, URL <chr> res <- dplyr::bind_rows(x) class(res) ## [1] "tbl_df"     "tbl"        "data.frame" head(res) ## # A tibble: 6 × 28 ##   CATEGORY    BIBTEXKEY ADDRESS ANNOTE AUTHOR BOOKTITLE CHAPTER CROSSREF EDITION ##   <chr>       <chr>     <chr>   <chr>  <list> <chr>     <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   ## 1 ARTICLE     Arrow1986 NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ## 2 ARTICLE     AumannBr… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ## 3 ARTICLE     Aumann19… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ## 4 INCOLLECTI… Bacharac… Cambri… NA     <chr>  Knowledg… 17      NA       NA      ## 5 ARTICLE     Basu1988  NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ## 6 ARTICLE     Bernheim… NA      NA     <chr>  NA        NA      NA       NA      ## # ℹ 19 more variables: EDITOR <list>, HOWPUBLISHED <chr>, INSTITUTION <chr>, ## #   JOURNAL <chr>, KEY <chr>, MONTH <chr>, NOTE <chr>, NUMBER <chr>, ## #   ORGANIZATION <chr>, PAGES <chr>, PUBLISHER <chr>, SCHOOL <chr>, ## #   SERIES <chr>, TITLE <chr>, TYPE <chr>, VOLUME <chr>, YEAR <dbl>, DOI <chr>, ## #   URL <chr>

title: bib2df - Parse a BibTeX file to a data.frame
text: Since BibTeX entries now converted rows columns tibble, one can start analyze visualize data common tools like ggplot2, dplyr tidyr. example, one can ask journal cited among references median age cited works : Also plotting possible:
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(tidyr)  df %>%   filter(!is.na(JOURNAL)) %>%   group_by(JOURNAL) %>%   summarize(n = n()) %>%   arrange(desc(n)) %>%   slice(1:3) ## # A tibble: 3 × 2 ##   JOURNAL                                  n ##   <chr>                                <int> ## 1 Econometrica                             4 ## 2 Games and Economic Behavior              2 ## 3 International Journal of Game Theory     2 df %>%   mutate(age = 2017 - YEAR) %>%   summarize(m = median(age)) ## # A tibble: 1 × 1 ##       m ##   <dbl> ## 1    31 df %>%    select(YEAR, AUTHOR) %>%    unnest() %>%    ggplot() +    aes(x = YEAR, y = reorder(full_name, desc(YEAR))) +    geom_point()

title: bib2df - Parse a BibTeX file to a data.frame
text: Since BibTeX entries represented rows tibble, manipulating BibTeX entries now easily possible. One authors 10th reference file full first name: ‘E.’ ‘E. Dekel’ Eddie, lets change value field:
code: df$AUTHOR[[10]] ##   salutation first_name middle_name     last_name suffix          full_name ## 1       <NA>       Adam        <NA> Brandenburger   <NA> Adam Brandenburger ## 2       <NA>         E.        <NA>         Dekel   <NA>           E. Dekel df$AUTHOR[[10]]$first_name[2] <- "Eddie" df$AUTHOR[[10]]$full_name[2] <- "Eddie Dekel"  df$AUTHOR[[10]] ##   salutation first_name middle_name     last_name suffix          full_name ## 1       <NA>       Adam        <NA> Brandenburger   <NA> Adam Brandenburger ## 2       <NA>      Eddie        <NA>         Dekel   <NA>        Eddie Dekel

title: bib2df - Parse a BibTeX file to a data.frame
text: Especially single values parsed BibTeX file changed useful write parsed tibble back valid BibTeX file one can use combination LaTeX. Just like bib2df() parses BibTeX file, df2bib() writes BibTeX file: just written BibTeX file course contains values, just changed tibble: append BibTeX entries existing file use append = TRUE within df2bib().
code: newFile <- tempfile() df2bib(df, file = newFile) @Incollection{BrandenburgerDekel1989,   Address = {New York},   Author = {Brandenburger, Adam and Dekel, Eddie},   Booktitle = {The Economics of Missing Markets, Information and Games},   Chapter = {3},   Pages = {46 - 61},   Publisher = {Oxford University Press},   Title = {The Role of Common Knowledge Assumptions in Game Theory},   Year = {1989} }

what: bib2df - Parse a BibTeX file to a tibble
title: Parse a BibTeX File to a Data Frame
text: Everyone writing reports articles LaTeX probably used BibTeX . BibTeX de facto standard reference management grounds functionality list references stored local text file. Depending reference type, several fields necessary define reference properly. exemplary BibTeX entry looks follows:
code: @Article{Binmore2008,   Title = {Do Conventions Need to Be Common Knowledge?},   Author = {Binmore, Ken},   Journal = {Topoi},   Year = {2008},   Number = {1},   Pages = {17--27},   Volume = {27} }

what: Parse the BibTeX file to a tibble
title: Parse a BibTeX File to a Data Frame
text: BibTeX format convenient kind analysis visualization. Many R applications require data.frame (tibble) bib2df offers straightforward framework parse BibTeX file tibble. df2bib() function makes possible write tibble back disk, enabling programmatic manipulation .bib file.
code: library(bib2df)  path <- system.file("extdata", "LiteratureOnCommonKnowledgeInGameTheory.bib", package = "bib2df")  df <- bib2df(path) df #> # A tibble: 37 x 27 #>    CATEGORY BIBTEXKEY ADDRESS ANNOTE AUTHOR BOOKTITLE CHAPTER CROSSREF #>    <chr>    <chr>     <chr>   <chr>  <list> <chr>     <chr>   <chr>    #>  1 ARTICLE  Arrow1986 <NA>    <NA>   <chr … <NA>      <NA>    <NA>     #>  2 ARTICLE  AumannBr… <NA>    <NA>   <chr … <NA>      <NA>    <NA>     #>  3 ARTICLE  Aumann19… <NA>    <NA>   <chr … <NA>      <NA>    <NA>     #>  4 INCOLLE… Bacharac… Cambri… <NA>   <chr … Knowledg… 17      <NA>     #>  5 ARTICLE  Basu1988  <NA>    <NA>   <chr … <NA>      <NA>    <NA>     #>  6 ARTICLE  Bernheim… <NA>    <NA>   <chr … <NA>      <NA>    <NA>     #>  7 ARTICLE  Bicchier… <NA>    <NA>   <chr … <NA>      <NA>    <NA>     #>  8 ARTICLE  Binmore2… <NA>    <NA>   <chr … <NA>      <NA>    <NA>     #>  9 ARTICLE  Brandenb… <NA>    <NA>   <chr … <NA>      <NA>    <NA>     #> 10 INCOLLE… Brandenb… New Yo… <NA>   <chr … The Econ… 3       <NA>     #> # … with 27 more rows, and 19 more variables: EDITION <chr>, #> #   EDITOR <list>, HOWPUBLISHED <chr>, INSTITUTION <chr>, JOURNAL <chr>, #> #   KEY <chr>, MONTH <chr>, NOTE <chr>, NUMBER <chr>, ORGANIZATION <chr>, #> #   PAGES <chr>, PUBLISHER <chr>, SCHOOL <chr>, SERIES <chr>, TITLE <chr>, #> #   TYPE <chr>, VOLUME <chr>, YEAR <dbl>, DOI <chr>

title: Parse a BibTeX file to a tibble — bib2df
text: Philipp Ottolinger

title: Parse a BibTeX file to a tibble — bib2df
code: # Read from .bib file: path <- system.file("extdata", "bib2df_testfile_3.bib", package = "bib2df") bib <- bib2df(path) str(bib) #> tibble [3 × 26] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ CATEGORY    : chr [1:3] "ARTICLE" "BOOK" "INCOLLECTION" #>  $ BIBTEXKEY   : chr [1:3] "Binmore2008" "Osborne1994" "BrandenburgerDekel1989" #>  $ ADDRESS     : chr [1:3] NA NA "New York" #>  $ ANNOTE      : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ AUTHOR      :List of 3 #>   ..$ : chr "Binmore, Ken" #>   ..$ : chr [1:2] "Osborne, Martin J." "Rubinstein, Ariel" #>   ..$ : chr [1:2] "Brandenburger, Adam" "Dekel, Eddie" #>  $ BOOKTITLE   : chr [1:3] NA NA "The Economics of Missing Markets, Information and Games" #>  $ CHAPTER     : chr [1:3] NA NA "3" #>  $ CROSSREF    : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ EDITION     : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ EDITOR      :List of 3 #>   ..$ : chr NA #>   ..$ : chr NA #>   ..$ : chr "Hahn, Frank" #>  $ HOWPUBLISHED: chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ INSTITUTION : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ JOURNAL     : chr [1:3] "Topoi" NA NA #>  $ KEY         : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ MONTH       : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ NOTE        : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ NUMBER      : chr [1:3] "1" NA NA #>  $ ORGANIZATION: chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ PAGES       : chr [1:3] "17--27" NA "46--61" #>  $ PUBLISHER   : chr [1:3] NA "The MIT Press, Cambridge, Massachusetts" "Oxford University Press" #>  $ SCHOOL      : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ SERIES      : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ TITLE       : chr [1:3] "Do Conventions Need to Be Common Knowledge?" "A Course in Game Theory" "The Role of Common Knowledge Assumptions in Game Theory" #>  $ TYPE        : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ VOLUME      : chr [1:3] "27" NA NA #>  $ YEAR        : num [1:3] 2008 1994 1989  # Read from .bib file and separate authors' and editors' names: bib <- bib2df(path, separate_names = TRUE) str(bib) #> tibble [3 × 26] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ CATEGORY    : chr [1:3] "ARTICLE" "BOOK" "INCOLLECTION" #>  $ BIBTEXKEY   : chr [1:3] "Binmore2008" "Osborne1994" "BrandenburgerDekel1989" #>  $ ADDRESS     : chr [1:3] NA NA "New York" #>  $ ANNOTE      : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ AUTHOR      :List of 3 #>   ..$ :'data.frame':	1 obs. of  6 variables: #>   .. ..$ salutation : chr NA #>   .. ..$ first_name : chr "Ken" #>   .. ..$ middle_name: chr NA #>   .. ..$ last_name  : chr "Binmore" #>   .. ..$ suffix     : chr NA #>   .. ..$ full_name  : chr "Ken Binmore" #>   ..$ :'data.frame':	2 obs. of  6 variables: #>   .. ..$ salutation : chr [1:2] NA NA #>   .. ..$ first_name : chr [1:2] "Martin" "Ariel" #>   .. ..$ middle_name: chr [1:2] "J." NA #>   .. ..$ last_name  : chr [1:2] "Osborne" "Rubinstein" #>   .. ..$ suffix     : chr [1:2] NA NA #>   .. ..$ full_name  : chr [1:2] "Martin J. Osborne" "Ariel Rubinstein" #>   ..$ :'data.frame':	2 obs. of  6 variables: #>   .. ..$ salutation : chr [1:2] NA NA #>   .. ..$ first_name : chr [1:2] "Adam" "Eddie" #>   .. ..$ middle_name: chr [1:2] NA NA #>   .. ..$ last_name  : chr [1:2] "Brandenburger" "Dekel" #>   .. ..$ suffix     : chr [1:2] NA NA #>   .. ..$ full_name  : chr [1:2] "Adam Brandenburger" "Eddie Dekel" #>  $ BOOKTITLE   : chr [1:3] NA NA "The Economics of Missing Markets, Information and Games" #>  $ CHAPTER     : chr [1:3] NA NA "3" #>  $ CROSSREF    : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ EDITION     : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ EDITOR      :List of 3 #>   ..$ :'data.frame':	1 obs. of  6 variables: #>   .. ..$ salutation : chr NA #>   .. ..$ first_name : chr NA #>   .. ..$ middle_name: chr NA #>   .. ..$ last_name  : chr NA #>   .. ..$ suffix     : chr NA #>   .. ..$ full_name  : chr NA #>   ..$ :'data.frame':	1 obs. of  6 variables: #>   .. ..$ salutation : chr NA #>   .. ..$ first_name : chr NA #>   .. ..$ middle_name: chr NA #>   .. ..$ last_name  : chr NA #>   .. ..$ suffix     : chr NA #>   .. ..$ full_name  : chr NA #>   ..$ :'data.frame':	1 obs. of  6 variables: #>   .. ..$ salutation : chr NA #>   .. ..$ first_name : chr "Frank" #>   .. ..$ middle_name: chr NA #>   .. ..$ last_name  : chr "Hahn" #>   .. ..$ suffix     : chr NA #>   .. ..$ full_name  : chr "Frank Hahn" #>  $ HOWPUBLISHED: chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ INSTITUTION : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ JOURNAL     : chr [1:3] "Topoi" NA NA #>  $ KEY         : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ MONTH       : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ NOTE        : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ NUMBER      : chr [1:3] "1" NA NA #>  $ ORGANIZATION: chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ PAGES       : chr [1:3] "17--27" NA "46--61" #>  $ PUBLISHER   : chr [1:3] NA "The MIT Press, Cambridge, Massachusetts" "Oxford University Press" #>  $ SCHOOL      : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ SERIES      : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ TITLE       : chr [1:3] "Do Conventions Need to Be Common Knowledge?" "A Course in Game Theory" "The Role of Common Knowledge Assumptions in Game Theory" #>  $ TYPE        : chr [1:3] NA NA NA #>  $ VOLUME      : chr [1:3] "27" NA NA #>  $ YEAR        : num [1:3] 2008 1994 1989

what: Export a BibTeX tibble to a .bib file — df2bib
title: Export a BibTeX tibble to a .bib file — df2bib
text: BibTeX tibble written .bib file

title: Export a BibTeX tibble to a .bib file — df2bib
code: df2bib(x, file = "", append = FALSE, allfields = TRUE)

title: Export a BibTeX tibble to a .bib file — df2bib
text: x tibble, format returned bib2df. file character, file path write .bib file. empty character string writes stdout (default). append logical, TRUE tibble appended existing file. allfields logical, TRUE (default), resulting bib output include BibTeX fields contained df object. FALSE fields text included resulting bib object

title: Export a BibTeX tibble to a .bib file — df2bib
text: file character string, invisibly.

title: Export a BibTeX tibble to a .bib file — df2bib
text: http://www.bibtex.org/Format/

title: Export a BibTeX tibble to a .bib file — df2bib
text: Thomas J. Leeper Gianluca Baio

title: Export a BibTeX tibble to a .bib file — df2bib
code: # Read from .bib file: path <- system.file("extdata", "bib2df_testfile_3.bib", package = "bib2df") bib <- bib2df(path)  # Write to .bib file: # bibFile <- tempfile() # df2bib(bib, bibFile)  # Use `append = TRUE` to add lines to an existing .bib file: # df2bib(bib, bibFile, append = TRUE)

title: bib2df 1.1.0
text: version fixes failing unit tests CRAN. version published CRAN.

title: bib2df 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-06-02 bib2df() can now read .bib files single entry bib2df() now allows @ symbol within titles version published CRAN since version 1.0.0 beed removed CRAN due check errors.

title: bib2df 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-09-18 package version went successfully rOpenSci onboarding process. package now support AppVeyor builds. version contains aditional unit tests.

title: bib2df 0.2.2
text: Improved behavior malformed .bib files entries Improved behavior type conversion df2bib() now able append existing file Minor changes documentation vignette

title: bib2df 0.2.1
text: Improved formatting Removed exports internal functions Improved vignette

title: bib2df 0.2
text: CRAN release: 2017-05-21 Standardized return value bib2df() (#5, @leeper) Added functionality write data.frame back BibTeX file (df2bib()) (#5, @leeper) Adds testthat-based tests bib2df() df2bib() (#5, @leeper) Added functionality humaniformat package split names (#4)
